intro: Laseguea acutifolia ovata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved laseguea, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, ovate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
